text: Makhdoom Muhammad Ameen Faheem (; alt. spelling: Amin Fahim; 4 August 1939 - 21 November 2015), was an Pakistani populist left-wing figure and a poet and Spiritual leader, He was the senior vice-chairman of Pakistan Peoples Party. He was also the chairman of Pakistan People's Party Parliamentarians and former chairman of Alliance for Restoration of Democracy. He served as the Commerce Minister of Pakistan serving from 3 November 2008 through 16 March 2013. == Early life and education == born on August 4, 1939 in Hala Sindh, Pakistan, was the eldest son of Makhdoom Muhammad Zaman, == Death == Faheem died on 21 November 2015 from leukemia after being admitted to a hospital in Karachi, Pakistan under ICU at the age of 76. == References == Category:1939 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Pakistani politicians Category:Poets from Sindh
title: Ameen Faheem
